item.title: Oil Drops After Chinese Trade Data Disappoints
item.description: Oil prices declined in Europe after weaker-than-expected Chinese economic data.

item.title: Metal Prices Retreat Amid China Economic Woes
item.description: Base metal and gold prices were falling as weak economic data from China continued to signal poor demand for industrial goods.

item.title: Glencore Profit Falls on Commodity-Price Decline
item.description: Glencore reported a 50% drop in first half adjusted earnings to $9.4 billion, reflecting the normalization of energy market imbalances, and the decline of commodity prices.

item.title: SoftBank Posts Another Loss Despite Tech-Share Rebound
item.description: A return to profit for SoftBank’s Vision Fund wasn’t able to stem the red ink for the investment company.

item.title: Bayer Confirms Lowered Outlook
item.description: Bayer confirmed the guidance issued on July 24 due to a significant decline in sales of glyphosate-based products, and sees full-year sales in its agricultural business declining 5%.

item.title: USD/JPY Likely to Trade With Upward Bias, Charts Show
item.description: SGD weakened against USD in the afternoon Asian session. Weakness in China’s imports could be negative on currencies in the region, given the region’s reliance on China demand, Maybank said.

item.title: UK Retail Sales Rise
item.description: Retail sales in the U.K. increased 1.5% in July, though this masked a drop in volumes as inflation ran high, and as wet weather dampened shopper demand.

item.title: India's Sensex Flat; Tech, Financial Stocks Support
item.description: India’s Sensex was flat at 65925.85 as gains in tech and financial stocks helped offset losses in consumer goods stocks.

item.title: Will Pickup-Truck Fans Embrace Tesla's Cybertruck?
item.description: The launch of Tesla’s Cybertruck is one of the most anticipated EV releases in history. Barclays analyst Dan Levy and AlixPartners’ Mark Wakefield weigh in on how Tesla’s first pickup could shake up the market.

item.title: Voters in Argentina living with inflation in excess of 100% and a fast-depreciating currency are expected to hand a rebuke on Sunday to the ruling Peronist movement that has governed the country for mostof the past 75 years, polls show.
item.description: Voters in Argentina living with inflation in excess of 100% and a fast-depreciating currency are expected to hand a rebuke on Sunday to the ruling Peronist movement that has governed the country for most of the past 75 years, polls show.

item.title: A federal appeals court put on hold a Biden administration program to make it easier for defrauded borrowers to have their student debt canceled.
item.description: A federal appeals court put on hold a Biden administration program to make it easier for defrauded borrowers to have their student debt canceled.

item.title: Kim sought to showcase North Korea's defense industries and its nuclear-weapons arsenal, as U.S. and South Korean officials worry Pyongyang may seek to expand its illegal weapons trade.
item.description: Kim sought to showcase North Korea’s defense industries and its nuclear-weapons arsenal, as U.S. and South Korean officials worry Pyongyang may seek to expand its illegal weapons trade.

item.title: Already facing three criminal indictments, Trump is bracing for a potential fourth in Georgia that is likely to come with a legal twist he hasn't faced yet: sprawling racketeering charges.
item.description: Already facing three criminal indictments, Trump is bracing for a potential fourth in Georgia that is likely to come with a legal twist he hasn’t faced yet: sprawling racketeering charges.

item.title: Florida Gov. DeSantis further distanced himself from Trump's false claims that he won the 2020 election, saying in a television interview that "of course he lost."
item.description: Florida Gov. DeSantis further distanced himself from Trump’s false claims that he won the 2020 election, saying in a television interview that “of course he lost.”

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
item.description: What’s News: World-Wide

item.title: Tyson said it is closing chicken plants in three states as the meat-processing giant posted a $417 million loss for the three months ended July 1.
item.description: Tyson said it is closing chicken plants in three states as the meat-processing giant posted a $417 million loss for the three months ended July 1.

item.title: Paramount Global said it agreed to sell book publisher Simon & Schuster to KKR for $1.62 billion in cash and would use the funds in part to cut debt.
item.description: Paramount Global said it agreed to sell book publisher Simon & Schuster to KKR for $1.62 billion in cash and would use the funds in part to cut debt.

item.title: Campbell Soup agreed to acquire Sovos, the parent company of food brands including Rao's pasta sauces and noosa yogurt, in a deal valued at about $2.7 billion.
item.description: Campbell Soup agreed to acquire Sovos, the parent company of food brands including Rao’s pasta sauces and noosa yogurt, in a deal valued at about $2.7 billion.

item.title: Major U.S. stock indexes rose, with the S&P 500, Dow and Nasdaq gaining 0.9%, 1.2% and 0.6%, respectively.
item.description: Major U.S. stock indexes rose, with the S&P 500, Dow and Nasdaq gaining 0.9%, 1.2% and 0.6%, respectively.

item.title: Aramco posted a 38% drop in quarterly profit due to lower energy prices and production cuts, but boosted its dividend by more than half, highlighting Saudi Arabia's dependence on oil revenues.
item.description: Aramco posted a 38% drop in quarterly profit due to lower energy prices and production cuts, but boosted its dividend by more than half, highlighting Saudi Arabia’s dependence on oil revenues.
